"Additionally, we could ensure that all images and graphics have descriptive alt text for users who rely on screen readers or have visual impairments. This would help maintain the accessibility of our visual content," another member suggested.

"Moreover, providing closed captions or transcripts for all multimedia content, including videos and podcasts, would ensure that users with hearing impairments or those who prefer to read can fully engage with our platform," another participant suggested.

"Furthermore, providing text alternatives for non-text content, such as graphs and charts, is essential for users with visual impairments. This can be achieved through descriptive alt text or using accessible formats like SVG or PDF/UA," another participant suggested.
